name: Diarrhea
description: Diarrhea is the passage of loose or watery stools, often caused by infection, food intolerance, or contaminated food or water. Most cases resolve within a few days with proper hydration.

mild.definition: Mild diarrhea with short duration and no danger signs

high_risk.definition: Severe diarrhea or diarrhea with dehydration or bleeding

criteria.other_symptoms: severe dehydration, blood in stool, persistent vomiting

self_care: Stay hydrated with water and coconut water
Eat light foods like rice, banana, and toast

medicines.name: ORS (Oral Rehydration Solution)
medicines.dose: Drink small frequent sips after each loose stool

medicines.name: Loperamide 2mg Tablet
medicines.dose: Adults: 4 mg initially, then 2 mg after each loose stool (Max 8 mg/day OTC)

doctor_consultation.message: Seek medical attention if diarrhea is severe, persists beyond one week, or is associated with dehydration, blood in stool, or persistent vomiting.

assessment_questions.question: How many days have you had diarrhea?

disclaimer: This is educational information only and not a substitute for professional medical advice. Seek urgent care for signs of dehydration or blood in stool.
